member.name: T:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute
member.summary: 扩展自Sirenix.OdinInspector.InfoBoxAttribute 优化中文字体的显示 使用方法和Sirenix.OdinInspector.InfoBoxAttribute一样

member.name: F:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.Message
member.summary: The message to display in the info box.

member.name: F:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.InfoMessageType
member.summary: The type of the message box.

member.name: F:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.VisibleIf
member.summary: Optional member field, property or function to show and hide the info box.

member.name: F:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.GUIAlwaysEnabled
member.summary: When true the InfoBox will ignore the GUI.enable flag and always draw as enabled.

member.name: F:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.IconColor
member.summary: Supports a variety of color formats, including named colors (e.g. "red", "orange", "green", "blue"), hex codes (e.g. "#FF0000" and "#FF0000FF"), and RGBA (e.g. "RGBA(1,1,1,1)") or RGB (e.g. "RGB(1,1,1)"), including Odin attribute expressions (e.g "@this.MyColor"). Here are the available named colors: black, blue, clear, cyan, gray, green, grey, magenta, orange, purple, red, transparent, transparentBlack, transparentWhite, white, yellow, lightblue, lightcyan, lightgray, lightgreen, lightgrey, lightmagenta, lightorange, lightpurple, lightred, lightyellow, darkblue, darkcyan, darkgray, darkgreen, darkgrey, darkmagenta, darkorange, darkpurple, darkred, darkyellow.

member.name: P:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.Icon
member.summary: The icon to be displayed next to the message.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.#ctor(System.String,Sirenix.OdinInspector.InfoMessageType,System.String)
member.summary: Displays an info box above the property.
member.param: The message for the message box. Supports referencing a member string field, property or method by using $.
The type of the message box.
Name of member bool to show or hide the message box.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.InfoBoxExAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays an info box above the property.
member.param: The message for the message box. Supports referencing a member string field, property or method by using $.
Name of member bool to show or hide the message box.

member.summary: Displays an info box above the property.
member.param: The message for the message box. Supports referencing a member string field, property or method by using $.
The icon to be displayed next to the message.
Name of member bool to show or hide the message box.

summary.para: 匹配时会先判断返回的Type数组长度是否与参数数量相同，然后逐个参数匹配是否符合，如果有Type为null代表不限制该参数的类型。

member.summary: Play the appropriate effect.

member.summary: Assume the correct visual state.

member.summary: React to clicks.

member.name: P:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.AllowSwitchOff
member.summary: Is it allowed that no toggle is switched on?
member.remarks: If this setting is enabled, pressing the toggle that is currently switched on will switch it off, so that no toggle is switched on. If this setting is disabled, pressing the toggle that is currently switched on will not change its state. Note that even if allowSwitchOff is false, the Toggle Group will not enforce its constraint right away if no toggles in the group are switched on when the scene is loaded or when the group is instantiated. It will only prevent the user from switching a toggle off.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.Start
member.summary: Because all the Toggles have registered themselves in the OnEnabled, Start should check to make sure at least one Toggle is active in groups that do not AllowSwitchOff

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.NotifyToggleOn(EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggle,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notify the group that the given toggle is enabled.
member.param: The toggle that got triggered on.
If other toggles should send onValueChanged.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.UnRegisterToggle(EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggle)
member.summary: Unregister a toggle from the group.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.RegisterToggle(EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggle)
member.summary: Register a toggle with the toggle group so it is watched for changes and notified if another toggle in the group changes.
member.param: The toggle to register with the group.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.EnsureValidState
member.summary: Ensure that the toggle group still has a valid state. This is only relevant when a ToggleGroup is Started or a Toggle has been deleted from the group.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.AnyTogglesOn
member.summary: Are any of the toggles on?
member.returns: Are and of the toggles on?

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.ActiveToggles
member.summary: Returns the toggles in this group that are active.
member.returns: The active toggles in the group.
member.remarks: Toggles belonging to this group but are not active either because their GameObject is inactive or because the Toggle component is disabled, are not returned as part of the list.

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.GetFirstActiveToggle
member.summary: Returns the toggle that is the first in the list of active toggles.
member.returns: The first active toggle from m_Toggles
member.remarks: Get the active toggle for this group. As the group

member.name: M:EasyFramework.ToolKit.EasyToggleGroup.SetAllTogglesOff(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Switch all toggles off.
member.remarks: This method can be used to switch all toggles off, regardless of whether the allowSwitchOff property is enabled or not.
